dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A 3.6 magnitude earthquake in the Caspian Sea, Sunday evening.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A three point six magnitude earthquake in the Caspian Sea, Sunday evening.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Seismologists recorded an earthquake in the Azerbaijani sector of the Caspian Sea on the evening of Sunday, April 27. It was reported that tremors with a magnitude of 3.6 were recorded at 6:13 PM local time (7:13 PM Astana time).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, the Azerbaijani sector, right? I saw that. Pretty deep too, wasn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA

dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. The Republican Seismological Service Center put out that info.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: You know, for a 3.6, that depth probably meant it wasn't felt too strongly on land, right?

dialogue_turns.text: Most likely not. But still, any seismic activity in that region gets their attention.
